Reviews.Title: “Hotei Reims - a little gem”
Reviews.Author: horseyonetwo
Reviews.Content: A small, pleasant hotel with helpful staff. The room was clean and of a reasonable size. Handily situated in a fairly quiet part of Paris although only a short walk from the buzz and close to Gare de Lyon and metro. A good place to stay - recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean sheets and close to Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Mechaieh
Reviews.Content: Hector Malot is a confusing street, and Gare de Lyon is huge, so it took me more than five minutes to shlep myself to the hotel; however, check-in was painless and the room was quite clean. Bedroom part was spacious enough to maneuver around easily; bathroom was pretty tight -- fine for a slim solo traveler, but I wouldn't want to share it. It was shower-only; tiles were a peculiar wood-grain pattern, but water pressure was nice and hot and stall had plexiglass doors (not something I take for granted in cheap hotels!). Noise was usual level for small urban hotel -- some street noise, some sounds from hallway, but nothing overly disruptive. WiFi free but very slow (you have to register through a third-party service, Noodo), so that would have been a downside if staying here for business; since I was here only overnight, it was not a big deal. AMEX card didn't work the next morning, so I ended up paying cash; the clerks' tags helpfully indicate which languages they speak, and I think every one I encountered was trilingual (French, English, and Arabic).

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Welcoming, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nimrud
Reviews.Content: Stopped over for one night between a late Eurostar and a mid morning TGV to Dijon. The whole hotel was clean and the staff friendly and helpful although the confusion over how much we should be paying in the morning was unexpected. We did panic as we walked up the street in the dark and could see no sign, especially since the view on G*maps shows the refurbishment! Once there and checked in we asked about restaurants and Le Viaduc was suggested. Even with the window open slightly the room was quiet. Breakfast was fine and reasonably quiet. Having stayed in other Paris hotels where breakfast was complete chaos this was a nice change. The hotel's leaflet about the walk along the Promenade Plantee was interesting as we had already walked this about two years before as far as the Bois de Vincennes. At our previous regular hotel on the left bank, prices seem to have shot up, so will definitely consider this one for a future long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but not great”
Reviews.Author: saughosh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Metro Station which makes it very convenient to go around. The rooms are small, and it is difficult to store baggage. The area is also a bit noisy and the air conditioning is not of very good quality. The continental breakfast is a bit pricey for the amount served. The room rates are however very reasonable. The staff are also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A good base to tour Paris”
Reviews.Author: Esskaywe
Reviews.Content: Although we did feel that the place was a little over-priced (the feeling dawned when we were checking-out), in retrospect i do believe that the place was alright! The earlier feeling was only due to the fact that we hardly spent any time in the room - even 3 days in Paris (in a whirlwind tour) does not provide you the luxury of doing so. Anyway, the room itself was comfy enough, equipped with a bath-tub which came handy to relax in after the day's exertions. Located proximal to the Gare de Lyon (5 min walk), it provided a good base to explore Paris from. Although you might be better off in the Latin Quarter as it is closer to the heart of Paris. Lots of good eateries and convenience stores nearby as well. The receptionists spoke good English and were helpful in providing directions and tips in touring the city. All in all,

Reviews.Title: “better than i expect”
Reviews.Author: neoh c
Reviews.Content: the hotel is easy to find, very new to the rail station . the only problem is the street system of paris. we were alloted an attic room, small but cosy, amenities are adequate.the breakfast at the basement cellar is a pleasant surprise. service is good. a good french restaurant 'la cafe viaduc ' is just a short walk outside at the promodate. hotel staff are freiendly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and comfortable accomadation”
Reviews.Author: Rossco90
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently renovated so the rooms and the general building looked very neat clean and tidy, and it has a modern elevator. The bedroom and bathroom were both excellent though the bedroom itself was a bit cramped. Overall the hotel is well located and represents pretty good value for money. All the hotel staff we dealt with spoke English and were very helpful. We paid extra for the breakfast for one morning and that was good being held in the renovated cellar which had a nice atmosphere. The Hotel is located close to the Gare de Lyon. The only suggestion for improvement is the rooms lack air-con(seems fairly typical around France) and although the temp was only between 25-30 Celsius the room was getting a bit stuffy so I not too sure what it would be like in high summer. The only way to cool the room was opening the windows which then let a bit of noise in. The windows were double glazed so it certainly was quiet when they were closed. Also like another reviewer I found the internet connection a bit flaky, though this wasn't a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: scarletangel675
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Reims is just a few blocks away from Gare de Lyon which makes it very accessible if you are coming from South of France. This economy hotel is tucked in one of the smaller streets which means lesser vehicles, lesser passers by which will help you achieve a good night's rest. They allowed me to do early check-in and the staff was kind enough to allow me to leave my luggages as well on my last day while i was maximizing my trip in Paris. Clean, good price and comfortable rooms -- that's what I need everytime I travel and I made the right choice at Hotel de Reims..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and... dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: JAB08
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in this comfortable and fairly priced hotel. The location is very convenient and although it is very close to Gare de Lyon, the road itself is quite. Unlike other hotels, the en-suite room we occupied on the ground floor is very spacious, and we could bring our dog with us! Staff are very helpful and courteous, and they allowed us to leave the luggage supervised while after checking out we had lunch before returning to the station. All in all a very good experience and we would use again.

Reviews.Title: “a very good find”
Reviews.Author: DRJStAlbans
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by previous negative comments as my room was cosy, comfortable and - despite being on the street - quiet. The staff were all exceedingly polite and helpful, the breakfast always fresh and well presented and the location was fantastic. My only whinge is that the internet connection was very unreliable. I had to work in my room and wasted hours because of the system repeatedly going down. The management really do need to address that. I would definitely come back on a leisure trip but would think twice on business with the poor telecoms.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommend! You can skip this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mfu0403
Reviews.Content: Not a bad location, near the Gare de Lyon train station... suitable only for people who do not want to commute to the station prior their departure. The room itself was old, and the carpet was extremely dirty. Staffs are nice, yet they couldnt help us much when we woke up by the construction on our floor at 830 AM! We called the front desk many times, yet, the owner of the hotel was the unfriendly one. We were being frightened by his impoliteness, and rudeness (esp. when we dont understand any French) The walls are quite thin... so we did wake up easily by any single noise. Also, they dont have safe in the room, so be prepared to bring all your cash with you at all times!! Again, you can try that if you cant find elsewhere near that station.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: arcdiver
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, easy to find and just 5 minutes from Gare de Lyon. We wanted a hotel in Bercy, and this was highly recommended on various booking sites. The room was a good size, everything worked, very clean, the staff were very helpful and welcoming. It;s in a nice area, just a few steps away from the Promenade Plantee - http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Promenade_Plant%C3%A9e - something I'd never heard of before, but very interesting. There are also nice restaurants close by too. I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: collinsCrowborough
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and small but adequate. The bathroom was also clean with a good shower, shampoo/shower cream and plastic cups. The street was fairly quiet and so we were able to have the windows open. The breakfast room was in the basement with no windows but it was very attractive with red table cloths. The meal was self service with a fridge for yogurt etc.There was also bread, butter, jam and coffee. The staff were very pleasant and we enjoyed our one night there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for small price”
Reviews.Author: emmagpreston
Reviews.Content: Awesome highly recommend it. So clean and nice and new and yet so cheap for paris. Will always stay there in future and recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “Good News and.... Bad News !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly-Dav
Reviews.Content: The good news is that our room on the first floor had an excellent, completely clean and modern bathroom. Also, the breakfast facilities and food were very nice. The bad news is that the Gare de Lyon neighborhood is pretty isolating, since one must typically make two Metro changes to get to most places you'd want to visit. ALso, there is no air conditioning.... The bottom line is that if you don't mind being in a totally charmless and somewhat inconvenient place, this is a fairly good value (but only if you can get the same internet rate, 85 Euros without breakfast for two, that we did). (breakfast :7€)

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Reims
HotelInfo.Address: 26, rue Hector Malot, 75012 Paris, France
